main event: A blue-white light was observed in Miamisburg, Trotwood, Oberlin, Ohio on January 3, 1966.
interesting points: The object was classified as an 'Astro (METEOR)' in the conclusion section.
The object appeared as a solid, bright light, brighter than the brightest stars.
The object moved easterly and slowly disappeared from view.
The witness estimated the object was very high in the sky.
The witness described the object as making a hissing sound and changing colors from white to reddish-bluish.
